bibl.title: K. Mashāhid al-asrār al-qudsiyya
كتاب مشاهد الأسرار القدسية
Contemplations of the Holy Mysteries
bibl.incipit: katabtu hādhihi al-risāla ilā aṣhāb al-shaykh al-fāḍil al-ʿārif ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz b. Abū Bakr al-Qurashī al-Mahdawī... al-ḥamdu lillāh rabb al-ʿālamīn ḥamdan aniyyatan lā ḥamdan huwiyyatan
bibl.explicit: Closing Words of Text (exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it).
bibl.author: Ibn al-ʿArabī
bibl.date: Terminus post quem and terminus ante quem

noteGrp.note: An early work, written in the Maghreb, but we do not know whether the version we have is the same as the first recension. It consists of 14 contemplations in the style of Niffarī’s Mawāqif. There are two commentaries, one by Ibn Sawdakīn and one by Sitt al-ʿAjam, which have been used in a critical Spanish edition and an English translation of Mashāhid. There are two associated works; a prologue which is classifed by OY as RG 626, and a commentary by Ibn Sawdakīn classified as RG 684.

bibl.note: A much copied work, verified by three historic mss. The best is probably Manisa 1183 (651H, copied by a direct disciple of IA’s) and Veliyuddin 1782 (929H, copied from an original dated 596H). Some texts include the prologue (RG 626) and an epilogue. We have classified all these under RG 432 as it is too complex to make distinctions. Michel Chodkiewicz has examined both the Manisa ms, and the Paris National ms (B. N. 6104). He finds a slight difference between them in Ibn ʿArabi’s commentary.
